TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed AuthenticationLevel extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies client requirements for authentication and impersonation when using the class and derived classes to request a resource.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The values of this enumeration are used to set the <xref:System.Net.WebRequest.AuthenticationLevel%2A> property.
> [!NOTE] > The MutualAuthRequired and MutualAuthRequested values are relevant for Kerberos authentication. Kerberos authentication can be supported directly, or can be used if the Negotiate security protocol is used to select the actual security protocol. For more information about authentication protocols, see [Internet Authentication](../Topic/Internet%20Authentication.md).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates setting the authentication flags for a request.
[!code-cpp[NCLCredPolicy#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.net.security.au_1_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[NCLCredPolicy#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.net.security.au_1_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Security.AuthenticationLevel MutualAuthRequested = int32(1)

Docs.summary: The client and server should be authenticated. The request does not fail if the server is not authenticated. To determine whether mutual authentication occurred, check the value of the property.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Security.AuthenticationLevel MutualAuthRequired = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The client and server should be authenticated. If the server is not authenticated, your application will receive an with a inner exception that indicates that mutual authentication failed

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Security.AuthenticationLevel None = int32(0)

Docs.summary: No authentication is required for the client and server.
